Package pyramid.plunder

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Background
    The background of the game is drawn and imported; this Background Class extends the Drawable Class; it uses a for-loop to create the background with specified coordinates.
    Bat
    This Bat Class extends NPC; the location, size, health, attack, speed, damage, flight, and sightDistance of the Bat is implemented here in the game.
    Coin
    The class here creates the coin image in the game; Coin extends the PhysicsObject Class; this implements the size and the random locations for the game.
    Drawable
    This is the abstract Drawable Class; int keyLevel and boolean isGameObject are implemented; the getNextkey and isGameObject is defined as well.
    EndCoin
    This EndCoin Class extends Coin; this class implements the images and values for the various coins the game.
    ErrorLogger
    This ErrorLogger Class writes the error logs on a text file; various messages are prompted for the user to indicate system response.
    GameObject
    This abstract GameObject class extends the Drawable Class, major facets of the game are made and implemented here.
    GameRunner
    This GameRunner Class extends JPanel, which is used for the screens, and implements KeyListener, an important facet for the whole game.
    GraphicsManager
    This GraphicsManager Class loads the various images and is returned.
    HealthOrb
    This HealthOrb Class extends PhysicsObjecs; sets the location, implements game usage, and draws the orb.
    HighScore
    This HighScore Class stores high scores in a txt file using an arraylist; they can be retrieved and saved on the HighScores file.
    LevelMenu
    This LevelMenu Class extends Jpanel; many functions and objectives of the game are met through this class, for example the various options in the Main Menu for the user are created, the pyramid difficulty are set, the shop for materials and resources is created, and the options to buy, sell, and statistics for the materials are able to show-this is randomly selected, a unique feature.
    LevelRunner
    This LevelRunner Class creates multiple platforms for the game, the user is able to select the specific levels which he/she wishes to take part in; the various levels are randomly generated (with the platforms) and six generations are made available for the user.
    Loot
    This Loot Class extends the PhysicsObject; the image, the weapon, the int location and the int maxValue are implemented; the playability of the loot is also made.
    MainMenu
    This MainMenu Class extends JPanel, which is used for the screens; it creates the first menu being shown to the user; various items are defined for the playability for the game and for the user.
    MenuFrame
    This MenuFrame Class extends JFrame and implements the WindowFocusListener, and WindowListener which are necessary for the many functions and uses of the window.
    Mummy
    This Mummy Class extends the NPC; the random locations and characteristics of sprite images, health, armor, speed, attack, moveAtRest, and jump are implemented in the game.
    Music
    In this Music Class, the sound file is played for the duration of the background.
    NPC
    This abstract NPC Class extends Player; the various characteristics for the player are implemented, such as speed, sightDistance, attack, movement, jumps, and rest, move, and attack Images.
    OptionsMenu
    In this OptionsMenu Class the background is implemented with a color and dimension size, with the a specific location.
    PhysicsObject
    This class creates guidelines for the physics behind movement in the game.
    Platform
    This Platform Class extends the PhysicsObject Class; this class passes down the image and creates the platform in the game.
    Player
    This Sword class extends PhysicsObject class; the various characteristics of the player are implemented, the player is drawn here through the Draw method and Graphics g, other important characteristics are also developed.
    PyramidPlunder
    This main menu class presents the main credits page, and calls the loghandling class it also plays this- "src/TLPTheme Song.wav" - during the beginning.
    SaveLoad
    In this SaveLoad Class, a BufferedWriter is implemented in a try-catch statement for the user to save his/her game, the specific location and health is saved onto the .dat file in another try-catch statement, the game objects location are saved as well as their specific information, such as health and location.
    Shader
    This Shader Class extends the Drawable Method; this class uses various for loops to create the background; the fade and time is also passed to this class.
    SmallGun
    This SmallGun class extends the Weapon Class; where the characteristics of the small gun are implemented and where the Draw Method draws the gun and defines the location with the sprite.
    Snake
    This Snake Class extends the NPC; the random locations and characteristics of sprite images, health, armor, speed, attack, moveAtRest, and jump are implemented in the game.
    StartMenu
    This StartMenu extends the JPanel; this class sets the title and dimensions of the start menu; this sets up the various options available for the user- such as, Log in as a New User, and Log in as an Existing User- the username and password text file and log error is also set up.
    Sword
    This Sword class extends Weapons class; the various characteristics of the sword are implemented, the sword is drawn here through the Draw method and Graphics g.
    Weapon
    In this weapon class, the multiple randomly generated weapons are selected and available for the user to use; gives characteristics for the weapons being used; defines the size and locations of the weapons while setting the attack damage.
